statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: MD Baltimore Co 63, Towson 61
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Michael Knight scored 13 points and the University of Maryland, Baltimore County broke a three-game losing steak Saturday night with a 63-61 victory over Towson. John Zito added 10 points for the Retrievers (2-3), who have won nine straight over the Tigers. Jonathan Pease led Towson (2-5) with 13 points. Trevan Jackson had 12 and Lawrence Hamm 11 for the Tigers, who have lost four straight. Towson trailed by 12 with 9:03 left in the second half before Pease hit a 3-pointer from the right side and Tony Dixon followed with a basket for the Tigers' first run of the second half. UMBC didn't score after Andrew Feeley's inside move produced a 63-56 lead with 3:15 to go. Mike Green's basket and a free throw by Hamm got Towson within 63-59 with 1:51 left. The Tigers got as close as 63-61 on Trevan Jackson's two free throws with 17.6 seconds remaining. But Hamm's 3-pointer with 3 seconds left missed and Feeley grabbed the rebound as time expired. Towson connected on 6-of-11 3-pointers in the first half, but the Retrievers closed the half on an 10-2 run to take a 32-29 lead. Green's 3 put the Tigers up 26-20 with 8:23 remaining in the half, but Towson hit only one more field goal before intermission. Knight had five points during UMBC's burst, closing it out with one-handed floater along the baseline. UMBC opened the second half by hitting 10 of its first 15 shots from the field, and Brian Hodges' 3-pointer from the left side gave the Retrievers a 57-45 advantage.
